QueryText: preparation of Garlic  Chilli  Ginger extract 500 to 1000 ml per tank (10 litres capacity)
KCCAns: recommended preparation of Garlic  Chilli  Ginger extract 500 to 1000 ml per tank (10 litres capacity):This is a mixture of three plant extracts. 18 grammes of garlic is taken  the outer skin is removed and made into paste. A paste of 9 grammes of green chilli and 9 grammes of ginger is made. All the three pastes are dissolved in 1 litre of water. This mixture is stirred well and filtered before spraying.  500 ml of this extract is made with 100 ml of soap solution and 9.4 litres of water and sprayed on the top

QueryText: farmer want to know information about varieties in Pea crop?
KCCAns: VarietiesOoty 1  Bonneville  Arkel and Azad are the popular varieties under cultivation.Ooty 1SoilWell drained loamy soil with optimum pH range of 6-7.5 is suitable. Thrives best in cool weather. This crop withstand low temperature at the seedling stage.SeasonPlanting is done from February - March and October - November.Seed rate100 kg of seeds is required for a hectare.Seed treatmentTreat the seeds with Trichoderma 4 g/kg or Thiram and Captan at 2 g/kg of seed to avoid seed borne diseases. Treat the seeds with Rhizobium culture at the rate of 2 kg and apply 2kg Phosphobacteria as soil application just before sowing.Preparation of fieldPrepare the land to fine tilth.SowingSow the seeds at 45 x 10 cm in lineIrrigationIrrigation is done immediately after sowing and life irrigation is given on 3rd day after sowing. Thereafter irrigation is done once in a week. During snow fall irrigation is necessarily given to plants.Application of fertilizersApply FYM at 20 t/ha and 60 kg N  80 kg P and 70 kg K/ha as basal and 60 kg N/ha on 30 days after sowing.

I. Top Dressing with Fertilizers

a. Soil application
      
Apply 275 kg of nitrogen and 112.5 kg of K2O/ha in three equal splits at 30, 60 and 90 days in coastal and flow irrigated belts (assured water supply areas). In the case of lift irrigation belt, apply 225 kg of nitrogen and 112.5 kg of K2O/ha in three equal splits at 30, 60 and 90 days (water scarcity areas). For jaggery areas, apply 175 kg of nitrogen and 112.5 kg of K2O/ha in three equal splits on 30, 60 and 90 days.

Nitrogen Saving

a.  Neem Cake Blended Urea: Apply 67.5 kg of N/ha + 27.5 kg of Neem Cake at 30 days and repeat on 60th and 90th days

After 4-5 days after harvest, onion powder should be kept in the farm in small dhagy form. Then cut the onion and mud. Cut off the stomach by placing a stalk of 3 to 4 cm in length. After that, onion should be dry in the shade 4 to 5 days

QueryText: farmer want to know information about WATER MANAGEMENT in wheat?
KCCAns:
recommended for The crop requires 4 - 6 irrigations depending on the soil type and rainfall. Wheat crop requires minimum of 5 irrigations at the following critical stages.
I  Immediately after sowing
II  Crown root intiation : 15-20 DAS 
III- Active tillering stage : 35-40 DAS
IV- Flowering stage : 50-55 DAS
V- Grain filling stage : 70-75 DAS
Crown root initiation and flowering are the most critical stages. Water stagnation should be voided at the time of germination.

QueryText: Farmer wants to know information about water management in wheat crop?
KCCAns:
Recommended for the crop requires 4 - 6 irrigations depending on the soil type and rainfall. Wheat crop requires minimum of 5 irrigations at the following critical stages.
I  Immediately after sowing
II  Crown root initiation: 15-20 DAS 
III- Active tillering stage: 35-40 DAS
IV- Flowering stage: 50-55 DAS
V- Grain filling stage: 70-75 DAS
Crown root initiation and flowering are the most critical stages. Water stagnation should be voided at the time of germination.

QueryText: farmer want to know information about WATER MANAGEMENT in wheat?
KCCAns:
recommended for The crop requires 4 - 6 irrigations depending on the soil type and rainfall. Wheat crop requires minimum of 5 irrigations at the following critical stages.
I  Immediately after sowing
II  Crown root intiation : 15-20 DAS 
III- Active tillering stage : 35-40 DAS
IV- Flowering stage : 50-55 DAS
V- Grain filling stage : 70-75 DAS
Crown root initiation and flowering are the most critical stages. Water stagnation should be voided at the time of germination.

QueryText: What are fertilizer doses in garlic crop?
KCCAns:
Application of fertilizers
During last ploughing incorporate 50 t/ha of FYM; Apply Azospirillum 2 kg and Phosphobacteria 2 kg/ha, 40:75:75 kg/ha NPK, 50 MgSO4 and 1 ton neem cake as basal and N 35 kg/ha at 45 days after planting.

QueryText: Farmer want to know about how to  Controlling rubberisation in Garlic crop?
KCCAns:
Controlling rubberisation
Avoid excessive application of N to minimise rubberisation. N should not be applied in the form of Urea. Use Ammonium sulphate. Spray 1500 ppm of CCC or MH on 30th day of planting. Reduce the frequency of irrigation to minimise rubberisation. Apply 0.2 % Boron 0.1 % Sodium molybdate on 30th, 60th and 90th days after planting

QueryText: FARMER WANTS TO KNOW INFORMATION ABOUT  how to escape crop from frost ?
KCCAns: Kisan Bhai You have taken quick measures on priority basis to protect your crops. After half a night, smoke around the field so that the temperature of the atmosphere will increase and humidity will be less. Similarly, holding a long rope on both edges in the field and gradually moving out on the crop. As a result the frozen dew on crop leaves will fall. For prevention of shedding, sulfuric acid 0.1 ml / liters of water should be split the slurry or dynamite sulfoxide 0.075 dmso percent or soluble sulfur 0.3 percent 3 ml / liters of water or thiourea 45 ml / 15 liters of water. Sprinkle the solution. Thereby, the temperature of the crop plant cell will increase.

QueryText: farmer want to know information about WATER MANAGEMENT in wheat?
KCCAns:
recommended for The crop requires 4 - 6 irrigations depending on the soil type and rainfall. Wheat crop requires minimum of 5 irrigations at the following critical stages.
I  Immediately after sowing
II  Crown root intiation : 15-20 DAS 
III- Active tillering stage : 35-40 DAS
IV- Flowering stage : 50-55 DAS
V- Grain filling stage : 70-75 DAS
Crown root initiation and flowering are the most critical stages. Water stagnation should be voided at the time of germination.

QueryText: farmer want to know about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana?
KCCAns: The premium under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is way less than the previous government or private crop insurance schemes. The premium amount for Kharif crops is 2 percent and 1.5 percent or the sum insured for Rabi crops. Karif and Rabi covers most food crops and oil crops cultivated in India. The premium for commercial or horticultural crops (including cotton) is pegged at 5 percent for one year.

QueryText: FARMER WANT TO KNOW ABOUT VAR.OF LIME(LEMON)?
KCCAns:
Paper Lime - Because of its wide popularity, it is considered synonym for sour lemons.
    Authentic lemon - This type of lime suffers in the bunch, and its flakes take approximately 3 to 7 fruits. Authentic lemon yields 30% more in comparison to the paper lemon.
    Vikram Nimbo - Its fruit also results in bunch. A bunch takes approximately 5 to 10 fruits.
    Chakra Dhar Nimbo - There are no seeds in this lemon and its fruit yields approximately 65% ??juice.
    P.K. M-1 - This is also one of the more productive varieties. About 50% juice is obtained from its fruits.

QueryText: farmer want to know information about WATER MANAGEMENT in wheat crop?
KCCAns:
recommended for The crop requires 4 - 6 irrigations depending on the soil type and rainfall. Wheat crop requires minimum of 5 irrigations at the following critical stages.
I  Immediately after sowing
II  Crown root intiation : 15-20 DAS 
III- Active tillering stage : 35-40 DAS
IV- Flowering stage : 50-55 DAS
V- Grain filling stage : 70-75 DAS
Crown root initiation and flowering are the most critical stages. Water stagnation should be voided at the time of germination.

QueryText: farmer want to know information about WATER MANAGEMENT in wheat?
KCCAns:
recommended for The crop requires 4 - 6 irrigations depending on the soil type and rainfall. Wheat crop requires minimum of 5 irrigations at the following critical stages.
I  Immediately after sowing
II  Crown root intiation : 15-20 DAS 
III- Active tillering stage : 35-40 DAS
IV- Flowering stage : 50-55 DAS
V- Grain filling stage : 70-75 DAS
Crown root initiation and flowering are the most critical stages. Water stagnation should be voided at the time of germination.

QueryText: farmer want to know about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana?
KCCAns: The premium under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is way less than the previous government or private crop insurance schemes. The premium amount for Kharif crops is 2 percent and 1.5 percent or the sum insured for Rabi crops. Karif and Rabi covers most food crops and oil crops cultivated in India. The premium for commercial or horticultural crops (including cotton) is pegged at 5 percent for one year.

QueryText: Farmer needs information regarding control measures of pest in coriander crop?
KCCAns:
Bramhastra-  10 liter cow urin, 3 kg neem leaf, 2 kg pongamia leaf, 2 kg  custard apple leaf, 2 kg bel leaf, 2 kg castor leaf and 2 kg dhatura leaf
Recipes:- none of these five ingredients to mix all the ingredients in urine boiled in a clay pot put on the fire when approaching the four-boiled 48 hours in shade to cool off from the fire. Then cloth to filter storage.
Duration of use: Use -bramhastra six months now.
Note: Please storage in a clay pot. Urine do not keep metal utensils.
Spraying: One acre 3 to 4 liters to 100 liters of water mixed spraying Brahmastra.

QueryText: farmer want to know about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana?
KCCAns: The premium under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is way less than the previous government or private crop insurance schemes. The premium amount for Kharif crops is 2 percent and 1.5 percent or the sum insured for Rabi crops. Karif and Rabi covers most food crops and oil crops cultivated in India. The premium for commercial or horticultural crops (including cotton) is pegged at 5 percent for one year.
